_header: Thou heavenly Queen of grace our lodestar
Subjects: Virgin Mary, hymns to; hymns, to Virgin Mary
_description: John Lydgate, a version of ‘Stella Celi extirpauit’ — four eight-line stanzas (ababbcbc)

CamJes56.First Lines:
[T]hou heuenly quene of grace oure lood sterreWith þi chast
                    mylke plenteuous plesaunce…
CamJes56.Last Lines:
…Maide and moder by meyn of þi prayereSaue all þi
                    seruauntes from stroke of pestilence

CamTCC601.First Lines:
thow heuynly quene of grace oure loode sterreWith thy chast mylke
                    plenteuouse of plesaunceGafe ihesu sowke put awey the werreOf
                    pestylence to apese oure greuaunce…
CamTCC601.Last Lines:
…Mayde & modyr by meane of thy prayereSafe all thy
                    seruauntes from stroke of pestylence

BLHar2251.First Lines:
Thow heuenly quene of grace oure loodestereewith thy chast mylke
                    pentevous of plesaunce…
BLHar2251.Last Lines:
…Mayde and moder by meane of thy prayerSave al thy seruauntis
                    from stroke of pestilence

BLHar2255.First Lines:
Thu heuenly queen of grace our lood sterreWith thy chast mylk
                    plentevous of plesaunce…
BLHar2255.Last Lines:
…Mayde and moodir by meene of thy prayeerSauf alle thy
                    servauntis from strook of pestilence Explicit
BLHar2255.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. I: Religious Poems.
EETS
         e.s. 107 (1911; repr. 1961): 294-5.

BLAdd34360.First Lines:
Thow heuenly qwene of grace oure lodesterreWith thi chast mylk
                    plentevous of plesaunce…
BLAdd34360.Last Lines:
…Mayde and moder by meane of thi prayerSave al thy seruantis
                    from stroke of pestilence

Chetham6709.First Lines:
Thow hevenly quene of grace owre loodesterreWith thy Chaste mylke
                    plentyvous of plesaunceGave Ihesu sowke puttyst a way the werreOff
                    Pestylence to Appese owre grevaunce…
Chetham6709.Last Lines:
…O lorde Above Callyd oon & two & threffor her merytes
                    save vs fro Pestylence
Chetham6709.Attributed Title:
Stella Celi extirpauit / Que lactavit Dominum (f.
                    284v)
Chetham6709.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XVth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1939: 208-10.
